dailyPosts.title: ConnectTech2021 - Mike Hartington Deep Dive into Angular Builders
Setting Page Titles Natively With The Angular Router
dailyPosts.description: When building applications with Angular, one common thing you should do is have the page title update after each successful navigation. This helps with accessibility and improves the navigation experience. This is something you've had to do manually in the past, but a recent feature added to the Angular Router coming in version 14 handles this natively, while allowing you to customize its behavior. This post shows you how to use the Angular Router's new built-in feature to for setting the page title after each successful navigation.

dailyPosts.title: Provide and conquer — Injected Angular forms
dailyPosts.description: UX often dictates that complex forms should be broken down to steps, which are spread in multiple pages, and each one is typically validated separately. Sometimes it is also sent to the server for intermediate storage before the final submission. Using Angular, a common approach is to create one form per page, within the container component. The form is validated on submit, before moving to the next step. The form data is either stored in a service, populating the final model, and/or sent to the server. This approach works fine, however it is limited. Navigating between steps might cause inconsistencies as a change in a previous step might have impact on the final model data.

dailyPosts.title: ConnectTech2021 - Sergio Brito How to Organize an Angular Project
ConnectTech2021 - Patricio Vargas Performant and Accessible Angular Apps as PWAs
Single Component Angular Modules and Component Tests go hand in hand
dailyPosts.description: Writing a good test is not as simple as it sounds, it takes some guidance and practice to get it right. One of the key factors that make a good test stand out is the arrange (or setup) part. For Angular component tests, Single Component Angular Modules (SCAMs) help to make the difference between an OK test and a good test. With SCAMs, you end up with no fragile test setups with half of the code, which results in a happy and productive, team that isn't afraid to move things around.

dailyPosts.title: Progressive web apps using Angular 13 | Service worker | Push Notifications
dailyPosts.description: Progressive web apps tutorial - We see how to convert Angular 13 app to Progressive web app.  Service workers play the most critical role in the PWA of caching the resources and API data. The angular services SwUpdate and SwPush are available in the ServiceWorkerModule. SwUpdate service provides regular updates about the app in the server. SwPush service can be used for subscribing to Push messages from the server using both Push API and Notification API. App Shell provides a way of loading a minimal screen to make the PWA fast in the initial loading.

dailyPosts.title: Pure vs Impure pipe Performance
dailyPosts.description: Pure pipes are executed only when a “PURE CHANGE” to the input value is detected. A pure change is either a change to a primitive input (string, number etc) value. or changed Object reference. By default a pipe is pure pipe. Impure pipe executes every time irrespective of source has changed or not. which leads to bad performance.

dailyPosts.title: Tidy up your tests using component test harnesses - ng-Keralam Angular Conf - by Alisa Duncan
dailyPosts.description: Angular CDK's test harnesses allow us to write component unit tests that are easier to create and maintain. In this talk, we'll cover what test harnesses are, using Angular Material component test harnesses to tidy your tests quickly, and how you can extend the CDK `ComponentHarness` to create custom component test harnesses. With the magical power of testing harnesses, you'll be able to write tests that bring you joy.

dailyPosts.title: Angular Custom Dynamic Theme Creation
dailyPosts.description: Let's say if you want to create custom theme for an application by which you will pass the theme name or you can construct your theme by yourself.

dailyPosts.title: Building a Twitter clone with Angular & Firebase (Workshop)
dailyPosts.description: n this video, we have a hands-on workshop that you can follow along with the video to build a Twitter (mini) clone with Angular and firebase. Follow along, and show off to your friends afterward :)

dailyPosts.title: Angular To Do app with Angular Forms - part 2
dailyPosts.description:
We can already see the form data in the console in our application, and we know that there are other ways to pass data in Angular.

- Pass data with property binding.
- Passing data with Angular Services

However, in the context of Angular Forms we want to use FormsModule and FormGroup to 'tracks the value and validity state of a group of FormControl instances'.

dailyPosts.title: How to Ditch ng-deep! | Angular Monthly Meetup
dailyPosts.description:
Presented by Women Who Code San Diego

ng-deep has been deprecated (for a very long time). If you architect your component styles correctly, you don't need to use ng-deep ever. Find out how!

dailyPosts.title: Encapsulating Logic with Abstract Classes | Angular Monthly Meetup
dailyPosts.description: Presented by Women Who Code San Diego

dailyPosts.title: Component Interaction with Services | Services & Dependency Injection | Angular 12+
dailyPosts.description: In this lecture you will learn, how to do component interaction using services in Angular. Interaction between two or more components using services is super easy. Let's understand it with an example in this lecture.

dailyPosts.title: 5 *ngFor Directive in Angular 12 /13 | Angular 13 Tutorial | First Last | Odd Even | Track By
dailyPosts.description: In this Angular 13 Video Tutorial you will learn how to use ngFor DIrective. ngFor is one of the  most popular directive of Angular whichi is used to loop throught the elements in array. In This Angular 13 Tutorial I will show you how to use index, Odd Even  and First and Last.  Angular TrackBy also has been Discussed.

dailyPosts.title: Let's Peek into the Angular 14: What is Expected Out of it?
dailyPosts.description: Since Angular 13 was nothing less than an evolutionary upgrade, what can we expect from Angular 14? Let's have a peek into it.
